answers.answer: Hi,You haven't reached the right forum for the doctor; this is the survivor's forum.  But, we do have some experience we can share.I'm on Aromasin and it seems to be doing the trick for me.  It's been shown to be quite a bit more effective than Tamoxifen at curtailing the production of estrogen.  My estradiol (estrogen) blood level is at a negative 20 at the moment, and I take Aromasin only every other day.Please ask your doc about it; swelling of the feet doesn't seem to be a common symptom of it. It's got other side effects that are icky, like sore hands and hot flashes, but so what.  I'm alive!Good luck to you.

Thanks for your input. Tamoxifen does cause water retension in some patients. Are you taking for ovarian cancer. Are you having any pain due to Aromasin. I could not post my message in the other board due to quota for the day. God bless.

I am taking Aromasin to cut the estrogen production that all three (!) of my cancers depended on.  Yes, there's pain from the Aromasin, but it's much better now that I take it only every other day.  My joints hurt, in my hands, shoulders, feet, knees.  The morning is the worst time.  Within an hour I feel almost normal, and I feel pretty good for the rest of the day.Aromasin is in clinical trials for ovarian cancer right now, but I'm not waiting for the results.  It cuts estrogen production by 95%. All three of my cancers were estrogen-dependent.  Gimme that Aromasin!

question: Dr. Goodman:I have LMP type ovarian cancer (recurrent) and I was treated with Taxotere. My CA125 came to 9 after 18 chemo sessions from 225. (3 weeks on and 1 week off at reduced dosage). I had a couple of cancer spots in my peritonium and the catscan showed that these patches have disappeared. I am unable to handle chemo due to weakness and inability to eat as food has no taste. My gyne oncologist has put me on Tamoxifen for giving me some protection. It appears that Tamoxifen has caused swelling of my feet which is hurting when I walk. Is there any other alternate to Tamoxifen? I am taking Evista and Actos for diabetes. Thanks for your advice. Regards
title: Alternate for tamoxifen
